channel.title: Computer speed
channel.description: My computer has been going slower and slower lately and im just wondering any ways to improve this. It could be a virus although my virus software kaspersky says no virus or anything. I dont have even alot of stuff downloaded but anyone got tips to help me?

item.title: Computer speed
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:17, topic:342843”][quote author=(Anthony) link=topic=439249.msg3228726#msg3228726 date=1275840941]

No one has posted this but im just gonna try and restore my comp to when it was brand new or like a week later and ill just backup the stuff i wanna keep

As well as NTFS, the windows registry is horrifically bad and gets worse and worse as you use the computer - even with moderate use.

not if you don’t install a bunch of applications.
[/quote]
…

It still shouldn’t happen regardless of how many applications you have installed on the system. Doesn’t happen with the other main operating systems.[/quote]
im not saying its good, im just saying if ur rather minimalist you shouldn’t have hat big of an issue with the registry.

Read full topic

item.description:
@14harry14 wrote:

It happened to me too… My antivirus couldnt find it, but it was a malware… Try using a malware program, and then get rid of it Might sort out your problem…

item.title: Computer speed
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

marcbob:

No one has posted this but im just gonna try and restore my comp to when it was brand new or like a week later and ill just backup the stuff i wanna keep

I do it all the time…
As well as NTFS, the windows registry is horrifically bad and gets worse and worse as you use the computer - even with moderate use.

While you restore your windows os, why not try a linux based os like ubuntu.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer speed
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

It is Windows and its file system, other operating systems do a better job at avoiding fragmentation. Whereas Windows seemingly allows it to get extremely bad without any obvious intervention.

Run the Windows defragmentation tool on your hard drives. It won’t cure it, because there are so many things that contributes to Windows slowing down, it is just that shit. There are other things that you have unintentionally done like what jme is showing you how to fix, you know, remove all the processes that don’t need to be running in the background when they are.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer speed
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:4, topic:342843”]Start - Run - msconfig - startup tab - remove everything that you don’t need starting up with your computer.

You probably just have too much junk processes running in the background.[/quote]Gah you beat me to it… This is the fastest/most effective way of speeding it up.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer speed
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

marcbob:

I hear of a lot of problems with linux too so…

There’s really not that many problems. People just avoid It because not every program has a GUI, and they don’t want to learn how to use the CLI, Um, not all windows programs are compatible, but you can use WINE to use most of them. And there’s an equivalent program in linux for just about everything on windows and macs.

Read full topic

You probably just have too much junk processes running in the background.
[/quote]

Only like 6 things and it looks legit nothing that is much running.

Hello and welcome to windows.

Ya really. You got a mac?[/quote]

Linux
